name: Dr. Johny Walker
description: An orthopedic doctor, also known as an orthopedic surgeon, specializes in diagnosing and treating injuries or illnesses to the musculoskeletal system. The orthopedic doctor will work to repair and preserve the bones, joints, ligaments, and skeleton

name: Dr. Rajeev Menon
description: Cardiologists are physicians who diagnose and treat heart diseases and cardiovascular ailments. ... They only work with people who need special heart-related care or have had heart-related conditions earlier. A cardiologist will often focus on one type of patient. An adult cardiologist sees only adult patients.

name: Dr. Srilakshmi Kolluri
description: Dermatology is a branch of medicine which deals with all types of skin, hair & nail problems. Dermatology Department at AIG Hospitals is run by International Dermatologist trained in UK and USA. All procedures are carried out effectively and safely in the hands of a skilled dermatologist.

name: Dr. Rekha Paladugu
description: She has expertise in managing all kinds of kidney disorders such as acute kidney injury, glomerular disorders, chronic kidney disease, kidney stones, urinary tract infections, dialysis and kidney transplantation. She is well versed in managing different dialysis therapies such as hemodialysis, hemodiafiltration, peritoneal dialysis, CRRT and hemoperfusion/plasma therapies. Her special interests include critical care nephrology and kidney transplantation.

name: DR. Bharta Kashyap,
description: An ophthalmologist is a medical or osteopathic doctor who specializes in eye and vision care. Ophthalmologists differ from optometrists and opticians in their levels of training and in what they can diagnose and treat.

name: Dr. Siddharth Srinivas
description: A neurologist is a medical doctor with specialized training in diagnosing, treating, and managing disorders of the brain and nervous system including, but not limited to, Alzheimer’s disease, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), concussion, epilepsy, migraine, multiple sclerosis, Parkinson’s disease, and stroke.
